properties.name: camel.component.pqc.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.configuration
properties.description: Component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.pqc.PQCConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the pqc component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.health-check-consumer-enabled
properties.description: Used for enabling or disabling all consumer based health checks from this component

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.health-check-producer-enabled
properties.description: Used for enabling or disabling all producer based health checks from this component. Notice: Camel has by default disabled all producer based health-checks. You can turn on producer checks globally by setting camel.health.producersEnabled=true.

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.key-encapsulation-algorithm
properties.description: In case there is no keyGenerator, we specify an algorithm to build the KeyGenerator

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.key-generator
properties.description: The Key Generator to be used in encapsulation and extraction. The option is a javax.crypto.KeyGenerator type.

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.key-pair
properties.description: The KeyPair to be used. The option is a java.security.KeyPair type.

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.key-pair-alias
properties.description: A KeyPair alias to use in combination with KeyStore parameter

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.key-store
properties.description: A KeyStore where we could get Cryptographic material. The option is a java.security.KeyStore type.

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.key-store-password
properties.description: The KeyStore password to use in combination with KeyStore Parameter

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.operation
properties.description: The operation to perform

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.signature-algorithm
properties.description: In case there is no signer, we specify an algorithm to build the KeyPair or the Signer

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.signer
properties.description: The Signer to be used. The option is a java.security.Signature type.

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.store-extracted-secret-key-as-header
properties.description: In the context of extractSecretKeyFromEncapsulation operation, this option define if we want to have the key set as header

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.symmetric-key-algorithm
properties.description: In case we are using KEM operations, we need a Symmetric algorithm to be defined for the flow to work.

properties.name: camel.component.pqc.symmetric-key-length
properties.description: The required length of the symmetric key used

properties.name: camel.dataformat.pqc.buffer-size
properties.description: The size of the buffer used for streaming encryption/decryption.

properties.name: camel.dataformat.pqc.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the pqc data format. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.dataformat.pqc.key-encapsulation-algorithm
properties.description: The Post-Quantum KEM algorithm to use for key encapsulation. Supported values: MLKEM, BIKE, HQC, CMCE, SABER, FRODO, NTRU, NTRULPRime, SNTRUPrime, KYBER

properties.name: camel.dataformat.pqc.key-generator
properties.description: Refers to a custom KeyGenerator to lookup from the register for KEM operations. The option is a javax.crypto.KeyGenerator type.

properties.name: camel.dataformat.pqc.key-pair
properties.description: Refers to the KeyPair to lookup from the register to use for KEM operations. The option is a java.security.KeyPair type.

properties.name: camel.dataformat.pqc.provider
properties.description: The JCE security provider to use.

properties.name: camel.dataformat.pqc.symmetric-key-algorithm
properties.description: The symmetric encryption algorithm to use with the shared secret. Supported values: AES, ARIA, RC2, RC5, CAMELLIA, CAST5, CAST6, CHACHA7539, etc.

properties.name: camel.dataformat.pqc.symmetric-key-length
properties.description: The length (in bits) of the symmetric key.
